NealNew York University ArchivesNew York University ArchivesElmer Holmes Bobst Library70 Washington Square South10th FloorNew York, NY 10012(212) 998-2641university-archives@nyu.eduThis finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2018-12-20T19:33:52Finding aid written in EnglishDescribing Archives: A Content Standard
New York University Archives
Michael Martin Fennell Papers
Fennel, Michael Martin
Shapiro, Alan
New York University. Office of University Development and Alumni Relations
MC 142
0.25 Linear Feet in one half manuscript box
undated Michael Martin Fennel, New York University (NYU) alumnus, bequeathed $4.6 million in circa 1995 to establish the Martin F. Reddington Scholarship at NYU. The scholarship benefits students with financial needs who want to participate in NYU's undergraduate programs abroad. Materials in this collection include a photograph of Martin F. Reddington, a graduation photograph of Michael Martin Fennel, and two drafts of Fennel's article, "Our Lady of the Trenches." Materials primarily in English. Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Transferred from Alan Shapiro, Director of Gift Planning, Office for University Development, in 1995. The accession number associated with this collection is 95.032.
Arrangement
Materials are arranged by subject.
Biographical Note
Michael Martin Fennel graduated from Washington Square College in 1965. He remained as a student in the English department and received his Master's Degree in 1967. Fennel wrote and published essays and short stories. His grandfather, Martin F. Reddington, one of the pioneers of modern advertising in the 1920s, believed in the importance of higher education. Reddington's passion for higher education inspired Fennel to establish a scholarship fund at New York University to help students in need study abroad.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Michael Martin Fennell Papers; MC 142; box number; folder number; Repository Name, New York University.
Processing Information
In December 2018, the photograph of Martin F. Reddington was removed from the frame and placed in a new, acid-free folder. The graduation photograph of Michael Martin Fennel that was originally removed from the collection and placed in the New York University Archives Photograph Collection was reintegrated. All materials were rehoused in a legal size half manuscript box.
Scope and Contents
Materials in this collection include a photograph of Martin F. Reddington, a graduation photograph of Michael Martin Fennel, and two drafts of Fennel's article, "Our Lady of the Trenches." The articles provide an example of Michal Martin Fennel's writing style.
Conditions Governing Use
This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).
